launchpad_s_plus

Class DisplayPad

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • launchpad_s_plus.DisplayPad
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class DisplayPad
extends java.lang.Thread
    Class used by Display.java to turn on or off a pad. Pretty much the same functions. Except they are significantly simpler to use if called from the Display class.

    This should never be called directly from any games or animations. Only use Display.java
    Version:
    $Revision: 1.0 $
    Author:
    Helion

    • Constructor Detail

      • DisplayPad

        public DisplayPad()
        Unused Constructor

      • DisplayPad

        public DisplayPad(javax.sound.midi.Receiver lpout,
                  int pad,
                  int color,
                  int duration,
                  boolean Only)
           throws javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException,
                  java.lang.InterruptedException
        Constructor used to turn on a pad with 1 color
        Parameters:
        lpout - MIDI Receiver port (Launchpad S output port)
        pad - MIDI value locating the pad to display on
        color - MIDI value of the velocity to use (Used for coloring the pad on the Launchpad S)
        duration - Duration in MS to turn on the pad for if it is to be temporarily on
        Only - True if the pad should be lit permanently, false if it should be lit for the given duration
        Throws:
        javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException - Invalid Midi Data Exception
        java.lang.InterruptedException - Thread Interrupted Exception

      • DisplayPad

        public DisplayPad(javax.sound.midi.Receiver lpout,
                  int pad,
                  int color1,
                  int color2,
                  int duration,
                  boolean Only)
           throws javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException,
                  java.lang.InterruptedException
        Constructor used to turn on a pad with 2 colors
        Parameters:
        lpout - MIDI Receiver port (Launchpad S output port)
        pad - MIDI value locating the pad to display on
        color1 - MIDI value of the velocity to use for the first color (Used for coloring the pad on the Launchpad S)
        color2 - MIDI value of the velocity to use for the second color (Used for coloring the pad on the Launchpad S)
        duration - Duration in MS to turn on the pad for with the first color
        Only - False if the second color should be permanent, true if it should be temporary
        Throws:
        javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException - Invalid Midi Data Exception
        java.lang.InterruptedException - Thread Interrupted Exception

      • DisplayPad

        public DisplayPad(javax.sound.midi.Receiver lpout,
                  java.lang.String text,
                  int color,
                  int speed,
                  boolean loop,
                  boolean stop)
           throws javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException,
                  java.lang.InterruptedException
        Constructor used to display text on the Launchpad S
        Parameters:
        lpout - MIDI Receiver port (Launchpad S output port)
        text - Text to be displayed on the Launchpad S
        color - MIDI value of the velocity to use for the text (Used for color on the Launchpad S)
        speed - Speed at which to scroll the text on the Launchpad. Range: 0 to 5, 5 being the fastest
        loop - True if the text should be looped, False otherwise
        stop - True if the text scrolling should be stopped
        Throws:
        javax.sound.midi.InvalidMidiDataException - Invalid Midi Data Exception
        java.lang.InterruptedException - Thread Interrupted Exception
